name: EDM Club
social_expectations: Dancing over talking, crowd energy focused on DJ, phone cameras out for drops, hands in the air
cultural_notes: The cathedral of electronic music. DJ as spiritual leader, crowd as congregation. Light shows and production value rival concerts.

name: Latin Club
social_expectations: Couples dancing, asking strangers to dance is normal, actual dance skills matter, fluid movement
cultural_notes: Where Latin rhythms take over. Dancing is the point - if you don't dance, you stand out. Often includes dance lessons earlier in evening.

name: Hip-Hop Club
social_expectations: Groups of friends, bottle service culture, knowing the lyrics, more segregated by artist preference
cultural_notes: Center of hip-hop culture in nightlife. Music spans golden era to current hits. Fashion is part of the experience.

name: LGBTQ+ Club
social_expectations: Radical acceptance, self-expression encouraged, drag shows as entertainment, anyone can dance with anyone
cultural_notes: Historically crucial safe spaces for LGBTQ+ community. Often includes drag performances, theme nights. Energy of chosen family.

name: Top-40 Club
social_expectations: Large groups, birthday celebrations, people-watching, generic fun atmosphere
cultural_notes: The default club experience. Plays what's on the radio. Attracts bachelor/bachelorette parties. Predictable but reliable.

name: After-Hours Club
social_expectations: Serious dancers, no phones on dance floor, the music is the point, people there for the art
cultural_notes: Operates late (often 2am until morning). Attracts nightlife die-hards. Often in warehouses or hidden locations. Music takes priority over everything.

name: Student Club
social_expectations: Pre-gaming culture, meeting new people, low inhibitions, dancing in packs
cultural_notes: College/university area staple. Student IDs for discounts. Theme nights (80s, 90s) popular. Where many have their first club experiences.

name: High-End Bottle-Service Club
social_expectations: VIP areas, bottle service as status, dress code enforced, networking, performers in cages
cultural_notes: Status-driven nightlife. Tables are territory. Often attached to high-end restaurants or hotels. Promoters and guest lists control access.
